author: dviner
msg: This is an XML Spy project file.  To use it, open XML Spy,
then under the Project pulldown, choose Open Project.
Select this file and click open.
If nothing happens, go to the Window pulldown menu, and select Project Window.
Then a box on the left should appear with the directory hierarchy of all the
XML documents from Xindice.
I haven't figured out how to get it to run forrest yet, but that would
be cool.  But even without that, this is really helpful for editing
XML files in XML Spy.
--dviner

author: dviner
msg: Here are a bunch of docs that I've compiled tracing my experiences so far
in Compiling and Installing xindice 1.1.  I don't have examples for the
Unix versions, but I'm sure someone can provide the info there.
--dviner

author: dviner
msg: I made the links for downloading the Xindice source absolute.  No local installation
will be able to download the sources anyway, so this makes sense to me.  Let me know if
you think otherwise.
--dviner

author: vladimir
msg: Updating some Javadoc to match the XMLDB:API (methods' documentation and parameters).
